adjective.description: Relating to the ancient Church of Gaul or France.
Of or holding a doctrine (reaching its peak in the 17th century) which asserted the freedom of the Roman Catholic Church in France and elsewhere from the ecclesiastical authority of the papacy.

noun.description: An adherent of the Gallican doctrine.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French gallican, or from Latin Gallicanus, from Gallicus (see Gallic).
